intro: Satureja calamintha var. nepeta, commonly known as caraway-scented mint, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that have a strong, pungent aroma. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and herbal collections.
